abstract.p: Forbes magazine ranks Cablevision chairman Charles F Dolen, of Oyster Bay, with estimated worth of $3 billion, as Long Island's weathiest resident (S)

block.p: Charles F. Dolan, the chairman of Cablevision, is Long Island's wealthiest resident, Forbes magazine says. Mr. Dolan, 73, who lives in Oyster Bay, is worth an estimated $3 billion, ranking him 80th on the magazine's list of the 400 richest Americans, published in the Oct. 9 issue.
Kenneth G. Langone, 65, of Roslyn Heights, a founder of Home Depot, was ranked 218th with $1.3 billion in estimated wealth.

Charles F. Dolan, the chairman of Cablevision, is Long Island's wealthiest resident, Forbes magazine says. Mr. Dolan, 73, who lives in Oyster Bay, is worth an estimated $3 billion, ranking him 80th on the magazine's list of the 400 richest Americans, published in the Oct. 9 issue.
Kenneth G. Langone, 65, of Roslyn Heights, a founder of Home Depot, was ranked 218th with $1.3 billion in estimated wealth.
Charles B. Wang, 56, the chairman of Computer Associates, who lives in Oyster Bay, ranked 330th, with an estimated wealth of $890 million.
Park Electrochemical Sales and Earnings Rise

The Park Electrochemical Corporation (NYSE: PKE) of Lake Success has reported that its sales increased to $129.9 million for the second quarter, up from $107.7 million in the same period last year. Sales for the first six months were $250 million, up from $212 million last year.

Park reported second-quarter earnings of $11.7 million, up from $6 million in the second quarter last year. Earnings for the first six months were $20.5 million, compared with $11.7 million last year.

Earnings per share also increased, to $1.10 for basic shares for the quarter, up from 58 cents last year. Earnings for diluted shares increased to 95 cents for the quarter, up from 53 cents last year.
American Tissue Buys Global Tissue of Memphis
American Tissue Inc., a closely held Hauppauge company, has acquired Global Tissue of Memphis. American Tissue, a toilet paper manufacturer, would not say what price it paid.
The acquisition will increase the company's distribution and production capabilities and strengthen its position in the Southeast.
In the past year, American Tissue has greatly expanded its operations through acquisitions, including the purchase the American Pad & Paper Company in August.
